snippet: September numbers were up, but the gain was less impressive than it sounded, because it compared with September 2012, a horrible month for European car sales.
abstract: Auto sales in European Union rose 5.4 percent in September compared with September 2012, biggest increase in more than two years; gain is tempered by September 2012 being worst month for sales in recent history.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and RAPHAEL MINDER
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt, and Raphael Minder from Madrid. David Jolly contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: September numbers were up, but the gain was less impressive than it sounded, because it compared with September 2012, a horrible month for European car sales.

headline.main: Slim Gain in Car Sales Leads to Optimism, and Skepticism, in Europe
headline.print_headline: Meager Gain in Auto Sales Stimulates Optimism, and Skepticism, in Europe
